snippet: The International Center has been unable to reach an agreement with its landlord to stay in its building on West 23rd Street, but volunteers hope to salvage it in a new location.
abstract: International Center in Manhattan, which has taught English and helped immigrants assimilate for decades, shocks its more than 300 active volunteers with the news that it faces dissolution and eviction; volunteers and staff have responded with an effort to find a new home and raise money for the center that they view as a family and cultural hub in the city.
lead_paragraph: The International Center has been unable to reach an agreement with its landlord to stay in its building on West 23rd Street, but volunteers hope to salvage it in a new location.

headline.seo: International Center, a School for Immigrants, Faces Closure
headline.main: Volunteers Scramble to Save a School for Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Volunteers Scramble to Save a School for Immigrants
